step_by_step_thinking: The patient's history of hypertension, family history of kidney disease, and palpable flank masses suggest polycystic kidney disease (PKD). PKD is associated with cerebral aneurysms, which are a critical complication. Documents [6][7], and [14] emphasize screening for cerebral aneurysms in PKD patients, especially with a family history. MR angiography of the brain (option D) is the appropriate test to detect cerebral aneurysms. Other options (colonoscopy, EGD, liver function tests) are not directly related to PKD complications.
